3.verse: The enemy pursues me,

4.verse: So my spirit grows faint within me;

5.verse: I remember ( I ) the days of long ago;

6.verse: I spread out my hands ( K ) to you;

7.verse: Answer me quickly, ( L ) Lord ;

8.verse: Let the morning bring me word of your unfailing love, ( O )

9.verse: Rescue me ( R ) from my enemies, ( S ) Lord ,

10.verse: Teach me ( T ) to do your will,

11.verse: For your name’s sake, ( X ) Lord , preserve my life; ( Y )

12.verse: In your unfailing love, silence my enemies; ( AA )

1.verse: Praise be to the Lord my Rock, ( A )

2.verse: He is my loving God and my fortress, ( B )

3.verse: Lord , what are human beings ( F ) that you care for them,

4.verse: They are like a breath; ( G )

5.verse: Part your heavens, ( I ) Lord , and come down; ( J )

6.verse: Send forth lightning ( L ) and scatter ( M ) the enemy;

7.verse: Reach down your hand from on high; ( O )

8.verse: whose mouths are full of lies, ( S )

9.verse: I will sing a new song ( V ) to you, my God;

10.verse: to the One who gives victory to kings, ( X )

11.verse: deliver me;

12.verse: Then our sons in their youth

13.verse: Our barns will be filled ( AG )

14.verse: our oxen ( AH ) will draw heavy loads.

15.verse: Blessed is the people ( AK ) of whom this is true;

1.verse: I will exalt you, ( A ) my God the King; ( B )

2.verse: Every day I will praise ( D ) you

3.verse: Great ( F ) is the Lord and most worthy of praise; ( G )

4.verse: One generation ( I ) commends your works to another;

5.verse: They speak of the glorious splendor ( L ) of your majesty—

6.verse: They tell ( N ) of the power of your awesome works— ( O )

7.verse: They celebrate your abundant goodness ( R )

8.verse: The Lord is gracious and compassionate, ( U )

9.verse: The Lord is good ( W ) to all;

10.verse: All your works praise you, ( Y ) Lord ;

11.verse: They tell of the glory of your kingdom ( AB )

12.verse: so that all people may know of your mighty acts ( AD )

13.verse: Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, ( AF )

14.verse: The Lord upholds ( AI ) all who fall

15.verse: The eyes of all look to you,

16.verse: You open your hand

17.verse: The Lord is righteous ( AN ) in all his ways

18.verse: The Lord is near ( AP ) to all who call on him, ( AQ )

19.verse: He fulfills the desires ( AR ) of those who fear him; ( AS )

20.verse: The Lord watches over ( AV ) all who love him, ( AW )

21.verse: My mouth will speak ( AY ) in praise of the Lord .

1.verse: Praise the Lord .

2.verse: I will praise the Lord all my life; ( B )

3.verse: Do not put your trust in princes, ( E )

4.verse: When their spirit departs, they return to the ground; ( G )

5.verse: Blessed are those ( I ) whose help ( J ) is the God of Jacob,

6.verse: He is the Maker of heaven ( K ) and earth,

7.verse: He upholds ( M ) the cause of the oppressed ( N )

8.verse: the Lord gives sight ( Q ) to the blind, ( R )

9.verse: The Lord watches over the foreigner ( U )

10.verse: The Lord reigns ( X ) forever,

1.verse: Praise the Lord .

2.verse: The Lord builds up Jerusalem; ( C )

3.verse: He heals the brokenhearted ( E )

4.verse: He determines the number of the stars ( G )

5.verse: Great is our Lord ( H ) and mighty in power; ( I )

6.verse: The Lord sustains the humble ( K )

7.verse: Sing to the Lord ( M ) with grateful praise; ( N )

8.verse: He covers the sky with clouds; ( Q )

9.verse: He provides food ( T ) for the cattle

10.verse: His pleasure is not in the strength ( V ) of the horse, ( W )

11.verse: the Lord delights ( X ) in those who fear him, ( Y )

12.verse: Extol the Lord , Jerusalem; ( AB )

13.verse: He strengthens the bars of your gates ( AC )

14.verse: He grants peace ( AE ) to your borders

15.verse: He sends his command ( AH ) to the earth;

16.verse: He spreads the snow ( AJ ) like wool

17.verse: He hurls down his hail ( AL ) like pebbles.

18.verse: He sends his word ( AM ) and melts them;

19.verse: He has revealed his word ( AO ) to Jacob, ( AP )

20.verse: He has done this for no other nation; ( AR )

1.verse: Praise the Lord .  ( A )

2.verse: Praise him, all his angels; ( C )

3.verse: Praise him, sun ( E ) and moon;

4.verse: Praise him, you highest heavens ( F )

5.verse: Let them praise the name ( H ) of the Lord ,

6.verse: and he established them for ever and ever—

7.verse: Praise the Lord ( K ) from the earth,

8.verse: lightning and hail, ( N ) snow and clouds,

9.verse: you mountains and all hills, ( P )

10.verse: wild animals ( Q ) and all cattle,

11.verse: kings ( R ) of the earth and all nations,

12.verse: young men and women,

13.verse: Let them praise the name of the Lord , ( S )

14.verse: And he has raised up for his people a horn,  ( V )

1.verse: Praise the Lord .  ( A )

2.verse: Let Israel rejoice ( D ) in their Maker; ( E )

3.verse: Let them praise his name with dancing ( G )

4.verse: For the Lord takes delight ( I ) in his people;

5.verse: Let his faithful people rejoice ( K ) in this honor

6.verse: May the praise of God be in their mouths ( M )

7.verse: to inflict vengeance ( P ) on the nations

8.verse: to bind their kings with fetters, ( R )

9.verse: to carry out the sentence written against them— ( T )

1.verse: Praise the Lord .  ( A )

2.verse: Praise him for his acts of power; ( D )

3.verse: Praise him with the sounding of the trumpet, ( F )

4.verse: praise him with timbrel and dancing, ( H )

5.verse: praise him with the clash of cymbals, ( K )

6.verse: Let everything ( L ) that has breath praise the Lord .
